alert.note: Alert for East Laramie County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:10PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kimball, southwestern Banner, southeastern Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 710 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Albin, or 20 miles northwest of Kimball, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 30 mph, and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albin and Harrisburg. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
